page.title: 06TRADE AND INDUSTRY
page.content: Aldbourne had a reputation for bell founding, weaving fustian and willow. Farm machinery, smithing and iron founding ceased quite recently. 86% of the working population earn their living elsewhere, although local firms include: 4 builders, 2 garages, 4 grocers, 2 electricians, 2 driving schools, 2 caterers, garden and household cleaning services, picture framer, furniture maker, carpenters, livery stable, butcher, photographer, newsagent, car hire, amusement machine supplier, undertaker, flower arranger, gift shop, 3 pubs, hairdresser, wine shop, Sub-Post Office, restaurant, plumber, fish & chips and an engine development firm. Barnes Travel is one of the largest coach firms in North Wilts and Palmers Stores now a mini-supermarket has been in the same family for 200 years
